reviewText:
So here's my two cents......

This game has potential, but building of the weapons is all wrong.  Parts don't fit (or atleast they don't look like they fit)  No  way to make money other than taking the $2000 and building a crappy gun and making about $17 evertime you go to the shooting range.  I built a rifle that couldn't hit a taget 2 feet away.  AWFUL physics!

Timer at the range starts even before you approach the bench.  Spent about 20 minutes playing this game, and will never play it again.   Thankyou Steam for having refunds.

reviewText:
Product received for free

tl;dr: Game abandoned by the developer. Last update as of the time of this review was on July 2015.

The current state of the game is basically a room where you have a workbench, a welder and a computer where you can buy randomly-generated-stat weapon parts online from, attach them to a single type of weapon frame(losing the previous attachment on that slot) and create a weapon out of them to test it on a firing range that gives you money for hitting targets. The only design consideration implemented is cost - and a more expensive part always ends up performing better regardless of its practicality. The end result once you throw enough money is a laser-accurate sniper machinegun. The problem? it's possible to get enough money to build one in less than an hour of gameplay, after which you hit endgame and there's no point in playing the game anymore because that's how limited in scope it is.

The game also has a lot of annoyances. It's possible to accidentally lose your weapon by dropping it through a wall, for example, or run out of money with an unfinished weapon. The options menu consists only of a music volume slider(which is a godsend as the game's music is absolutely annoying), and options for SSAO/Motion blur/vignette/bloom/antialiasing.

reviewText:
Product received for free

I got this game for free. Yes. I did not pay for this.
Very glitchy... I was messing around, testing the game and i could not do much.

Pros
+Has potential to be very intresting

Cons
-Can loose guns in the wall
-Sometimes guns will not shoot
-Sometimes welder does not work
-Start with very low money and can not do much
-Can't seem to add silencers to guns
-Accuracy is horrible no matter what you do
-Very limited selection of items
-It was laggy for me, even though im running it on a gaming computer
-The list of Cons goes on, while the pros are short and barely exist.

so far it will be a 1/10. I just can not stand to play it in its current condition.

reviewText: It is underwhelming at the moment.  You make a cheap and dirty gun, and shoot it at the range, make money for scoring hits at the range.  Make enough money; make a new gun to make money quicker. It has a lot of potential, to go either way.  Only a hand full of customization options (at the moment) and only one base.   Refresh the screen to get different stats most different for the cost only, and there are only 3 choices of mags (ak, m4, and rifle), the same three choices of barrel, 2 butt stocks, 1 silencer, and 3 sights.  In it's current state, the game controls not unlike a drunken cow in a shopping cart.  If they keep at it this will be one hell of a game, but it isn't quite there yet.\nAs an aside to the devs; you do not weld the barrel, site, or stock to a guns receiver, it's that because it is built to receive these parts, also you wouldn't use a mig, you would use a tig welder for seems work in gun smithing.\n

reviewText:
Product received for free

Hello! Yes, I did earn this game in a giveaway. And it is pretty impressive on the outside, but there are many flaws (Most you probably know).
Here is a list:

Lack of options menu for otherstuff than sound and visuals.
The music? Probably needs something to be able to turn off and back on (Possibly on the computer).
The movement of the player is sluggish.
The items on the wall should be able to be grabbed, giving new players a head start.
The invisible boxes around what you want to pick up are extrememly small, too small.
Money earned from the practice is too low. Needs to be their score (Rounded) and multiplied by either 2 or 1.5.
Mail box needs to be open (Possibly your package can take a few minutes, and you get a email about it).
Package could have a delay between when you buy it and get it.
Door in room (Window one), should maybe be able to be opened? I don't know, not like I'm trying to say Shoot bystanders" or anything like that.
The gun can be reloaded while ADS

reviewText:
Product received for free

Don't bother with this one.

Don't get me wrong the concept is pretty cool and all, but the game literally has around 10 minutes of gameplay, unless you want to spend time at a shooting range with guns that have broken shooting mechanics. Oh and the game got it's last update in July 2015. which was the beta version so I doubt we'll be seeing an update any time soon. The music is pretty annoying and after turning it off it turned itself back on a few times. Graphic options are minimal, and you cannot even change your resolution.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Got it free and even if I paid for this I might ask for a refund in my personal opinion.

Pros:Plenty of options for parts to make your weapon.
Make money with your custom made gun.

Cons:No way to remove attachments/parts once place on, can only replace attachments/parts, or make new gun. *Unless there away to remove them which I don't know how to, or it's not letting me do it.*
Making money is what make it get boring pretty quick, since you have to do it a lot just to get the good attachments/parts.

Opinion:In my personal opinion about how I feel about this game, it's not that great to be honest, and I wouldn't recommend anyone to buy this. If you have a thing about playing with guns, there a free to play game call World of Guns: Gun Disassembly, which you might enjoy more than this game, also you will have a much larger range of other options you can play with as well, such as RPG, tanks, etc...

reviewText:
Product received for free

So I tried to start the game. Got into the workshop, searched for parts, nothing. Oh you need to buy them online! But you have very little money. Keep clicking the sections' names so you get more options since you need cheap parts to start. The arrive inside your door in weird boxes. You can pick one item at a time...and when there are a few is quite hard to choose one or the other: you need to aim slightly higher than your target to pick it up.
Create > type at least 3 letters? From what? Tried random and got some gun. Ok should work, let's take it to the firing range  atached to the workshop but...how do I shoot? Tried some buttons but didn't work. Let's try to open this glass door and see where it goes and...wait my gun is somehow spining in mid air (and half of it is outside). Try to pick it up again and now my gun is outside and I'm locked inside. Tried to go back to the menu and now mu gun is half inside and half outside and aiming at me.
Turn volume down (to mute), Alt+Tab, loud music starts and I have no idea where it's coming from,go back to the game and mute again (volume was back to maximum somehow), wait some more, review, uninstall.
Pros? Soundtrack is ok and I like the way the workshop is very organized...

I got this game through a giveaway... Honestly, this game is awesome and it has a really nice potential!
Keep it up, always listen to the community, no DLCs, consult your gun dealers for more content (and ofc, give them a lil' credit if they want it:P) In the community hub/Discussions add a new section suggestions"
date:
check it daily looking for good ideas.
Here's a "startup" suggestion! Add e system which detects the weapons/parts if they fall out of the room to spawn them back in. (I accidentally presed E while looking out the windows and my gun flew out xD)

Anyway
